tasks.title: Notify Shift Lead
tasks.description: Notify the Shift Lead of an observed event.

tasks.title: Notify Intelligence Team
tasks.description: Notify the Intelligence Team that an event has been observed. Share contextual information as it is discovered.

tasks.title: Create Collaboration Channels
tasks.description: Create collaboration channels for Mattermost, Mumble, HackMD, etc. These should be updated on the Details tab under Additional Information.

tasks.title: Input Responder Information
tasks.description: Update the Details under Additional Information with the names of the responders.

tasks.title: Update Kibana URL
tasks.description:
Update the Additional Information section in the Details tab with the shortened Kibana URL.

In Kibana, this is collected by selecting the `Share` menu in the top left of the screen and clicking the `Shorten URL` hyperlink.

tasks.title: Identify the Aggressor
tasks.description:
Identify the `attacker` of an event.  Profile and perform analysis on this entity IAW local policies and procedures. Store your findings in the Task Notes.

This should be recorded as an `Observable`, marked as `Sighted`, and (likely) marked as an `IOC`. Tags should be updated as appropriate. 

If there are other Cases that have observed this entity (an Eye icon next to the entity), this event could be part of a larger campaign and should potentially be rolled up into a campaign Case.

tasks.title: Identify the Victim
tasks.description:
Identify the `victim` of an event. Profile and perform analysis on this entity IAW local policies and procedures. Store your findings in the Task Notes.

This should be recorded as an `Observable` and marked as `Sighted`. Tags should be updated as appropriate. 

If there are other Cases that have observed this entity (an Eye icon next to the entity), this event could be part of a larger campaign and should potentially be rolled up into a campaign Case.

tasks.title: Update Case Details
tasks.description:
Use the Task Notes to update the specific findings of the Case.

This should be a shared Task with the entire response team (Intelligence, Incident Response, Hunt Operators, Leaders, etc.)

tasks.title: Contain the Intrusion
tasks.description: Remove the adversaries freedom to operate and prevent new and re-infections to systems. This should also remove the adversaries ability to re-access by closing the mechanism they used for their initial intrusion.

tasks.title: Evict the Adversary
tasks.description: Remove the adversary's access and persistence to the contested environment.

tasks.title: Update the TLP
tasks.description: As details about the event are discovered, update the event TLP as appropriate using the [US-CERT's TLP decision matrix](https://www.us-cert.gov/tlp).  on the Details tab under Additional Information.

tasks.title: Update the ATT&CK Phase
tasks.description: As details about the event are discovered, update the [ATT&CK Phase](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Main_Page) on the Details tab under Additional Information.

tasks.title: Update the Kill Chain Phase
tasks.description: As details about the event are discovered, update the [Kill Chain Phase](https://www.lockheedmartin.com/en-us/capabilities/cyber/cyber-kill-chain.html) on the Details tab under Additional Information.

tasks.title: Return Systems to Operation
tasks.description: Once the systems have been properly restored, return them to operation.

tasks.title: Improve Security Countermeasures
tasks.description: Implement new, or enhance existing, security countermeasures. This could also include new network or host visibility requirements.

tasks.title: Generate Cyber Action Report
tasks.description: As appropriate, generate a CAR to provide additional contextual information for the Case.

description:
**REPLACE WITH CASE SPECIFIC DETAILS**  

[Remote System Discovery](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Technique/T1063) used by adversaries will likely be an attempt to get a listing of other systems by IP address, hostname, or other logical identifiers on a network that may be used for Lateral Movement from the current system. Functionality could exist within remote access tools to enable this, but utilities available on the operating system could also be used. Other examples could also include [System Service Discovery](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Technique/T1007), [System Network Connections Discovery](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Technique/T1049), [System Network Configuration Discovery](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Technique/T1016),  [Network Service Scanning ](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Technique/T1046), [Network Share Discovery](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Technique/T1135), or [System Information Discovery](https://attack.mitre.org/wiki/Technique/T1082).
name: Network Enumeration
